# Ajahn Chanda Thawaro

|birth_place = Baan Dang village, Roi Et Province, Thailand
|death_date =
|death_place = Baan Noen Haou Lo village, Phichit Province, Thailand
|nationality = Thai
|religion =Buddhism

|title = Abbot of Wat Pa Khao Noi
|location = Wat Pa Khao Noi
|occupation = Bhikkhu
|successor = Phra Ajahn Sathien Kantasilo
|teacher = Venerable Ajahn Mun Bhuridatta Mahathera
|education =  A third level certificate in Pali Studies

Phra Chanda Thawaro (), commonly known as Ajahn Chanda, or Laung Pu Chanda Thawaro in Thai, (), born as Chanda Chainit () (February 10, 1922 â€“ February 21, 2012), was a Thai Buddhist monk. Chanda is one of the best known Thai Buddhist monks of the late 20th and early 21st centuries. He was widely regarded as an Arahant — a living Buddhist saint. He was a disciple of the esteemed forest master Ajahn Mun Bhuridatta, and was himself considered a master in the Thai Forest Tradition.
